content.title: Aneurysm Morphology
content.definition: Fusiform (symmetric dilation) vs saccular (focal outpouching). Shape influences rupture risk and treatment.
content.statement: Aneurysm Morphology is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Aneurysms that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Aneurysm Morphology helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Aneurysm Morphology include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Aneurysm Morphology.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
